meanings.definition: To force air noisily through the nose and mouth
meanings.sent1: The little boy snorted with laughter at the silly joke.
meanings.sent2: The horse snorted loudly as it trotted through the field.
meanings.sent3: She snorted in surprise when the balloon popped behind her.
meanings.sent4: The old car snorted and sputtered before finally starting.
meanings.sent5: The dragon snorted smoke from its nostrils in the fairy tale.

meanings.definition: To express scorn, anger, or derision by snorting
meanings.sent1: The bully snorted in contempt at the smaller kids.
meanings.sent2: She snorted in disbelief at his outrageous claim.
meanings.sent3: He snorted mockingly at the idea of wearing a pink tutu.
meanings.sent4: The cat snorted at the sight of the cucumber on the floor.
meanings.sent5: The teacher snorted disapprovingly at the messy classroom.

meanings.definition: To inhale a drug through the nose
meanings.sent1: The character snorted the magic powder to gain superpowers.
meanings.sent2: He snorted the medicine to clear his stuffy nose.
meanings.sent3: The clown accidentally snorted the glitter meant for decoration.
meanings.sent4: The detective snorted the mysterious substance for clues.
meanings.sent5: The witch snorted the potion to transform into a cat.
